Title: Illuminated Tailpiece and Colophon
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Inscriptions: [Transliteration]  tammat al-kitāb bi-'awn al-malik al-Wahhāb wa-sallá Allāh /1/ 'alá khayr khalqih Muhammad wa-ālih ajma'īn / 2/ al-tayyibīn al-tāhirīn wa-al-hamd li-Llāh /3/ Rabb al-'ālamīn /4/ m (= tamma) /5/
Description: This illuminated tailpiece from Walters manuscript W.634 contains the final verses of the Divan and a colophon with prayers for the prophet Muhammad and his family.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Manuscript; Iran; Sufism; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Hafiz (Persian, flourished 8th century AH/AD 14th century)
